text: The 2018 Coventry City Council election took place on 3 May 2018 to elect members of Coventry City Council in England. This is on the same day as other local elections. == Current Council seats == The table below shows a summary of the make-up of the City Council before the 3 May 2018 elections. {| class="wikitable" !Party !Number of seats 2016/17 |- !Labour |39 |- !Conservative |15 |- !Total |54 |} == Number of candidates by party == {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ !Description of party (if any) !Number of candidates |- |Conservative Party |18 |- |Green Party |18 |- |Labour Party |18 |- |Liberal Democrat |10 |- |Trade Unionist and Socialist Coalition |5 |- |UK Independence Party (UKIP) |8 |- |Independent |2 |} == Election result in 2018 == == Ward results == The following tables show candidates for each Ward. === Bablake === === Binley and Willenhall === === Cheylesmore === === Earlsdon === === Foleshill === === Henley === === Holbrook === === Longford === === Lower Stoke === === Radford === === Sherbourne === === St Michael's === === Upper Stoke === === Wainbody === === Westwood === === Whoberley === === Woodlands === === Wyken === == References == Category:2018 English local elections 2018 Category:2010s in Coventry
title: 2018 Coventry City Council election
